parser.name: Care Plan
parser.text: At this time I am recommending:• The risks of not listening to me and not following medical advice were discussed with the patient.• The patient should continue with the prescribed medications, due to the fact that the patient has the necessity to relieve the chronic non-malignant pain syndrome described above in the assesment which requires more than 72hrs supply of controlled substances. • Heat and ice regimen should be followed by the patient at home at least twice a day.• Daily home exercises program involving cervical and lumbar stretching routine.• The body mechanics have been discussed.• The patient should not lift or carry more than 10 pounds or perform any repetitive and/or heavy exertion with the upper extremities or maintain the same position on his neck, thoracic or lumbar spine that aggravates his discomfort.• The patient has been recommended to avoid any extreme exercises and frequent flexion or extension of the spine. No driving while on any meds that may alter mental status.• Follow-up with Primary Care Provider for general care and HTN.• Follow-up with Neurologist (  ) for treatment of seizure disorder• The patient will follow up with me in 4 weeks or earlier if necessary.  • Information on nonopioid alternatives for the treatment of pain was given to the patient.• Increase Oxycodone 30 QID.The medication(s) prescribed above are medically necessary and have been prescribed for the length of time indicated due to:- Chronic Non-malignant Pain Syndrome described above in the assessment which requires ongoing pain management for more than 72hrs supply of controlled substances.Do not drive while on any medications that may alter mental status.

parser.text: At this time I am recommending:After reviewing the patient history and physical findings, once again I found sufficient cause-effect mechanism of injury connected between his subjective complaints/physical examination and the accident mentioned above.• The risks of not listening to me and not following medical advice were discussed with the patient.• The patient should continue with the prescribed medications, due to the fact that the patient has the necessity to relieve the chronic non-malignant pain syndrome described above in the assesment which requires more than 72hrs supply of controlled substances. • Heat and ice regimen should be followed by the patient at home at least twice a day.• Daily home exercises program involving cervical and lumbar stretching routine.• The body mechanics have been discussed.• The patient should not lift or carry more than 10 pounds or perform any repetitive and/or heavy exertion with the upper extremities or maintain the same position on his neck, thoracic or lumbar spine that aggravates his discomfort.• The patient has been recommended to avoid any extreme exercises and frequent flexion or extension of the spine. No driving while on any meds that may alter mental status.• Follow-up with Primary Care Provider for general care.• Follow-up with Neurologist (  ) for treatment of seizure disorder• Follow-up with orthopedic surgeon  regarding left knee s/p surgery• The patient will follow up with me in 4 weeks or earlier if necessary.  •  Urine drug screening done due to management of chronic pain, multiple drug ingestions, monitor compliance, drug adherence to prescribed drug regimen and to avoid drug diversion as recommended by State Regulations.The medication(s) prescribed above are medically necessary and have been prescribed for the length of time indicated due to:- Chronic Non-malignant Pain Syndrome described above in the assessment which requires ongoing pain management for more than 72hrs supply of controlled substances.Do not drive while on any medications that may alter mental status.Note: Follow up with PCP to order scooter. Patient with difficulties to ambulate and hand arthritis . Wheelchair will be difficult to manage

At this time I am recommending:***The risks of not listening to me and not following medical advice were discussed with the patient.**The patient should continue with the prescribed medications, due to the fact that the patient has the necessity to relieve the chronic non-malignant pain syndrome described above in the assesment which requires more than 72hrs supply of controlled substances.**Heat and ice regimen should be followed by the patient at home at least twice a day.**Daily home exercises program involving cervical and lumbar stretching routine.**The body mechanics have been discussed.**The patient should not lift or carry more than 10 pounds or perform any repetitive and/or heavy exertion with the upper extremities or maintain the same position on his neck, thoracic or lumbar spine that aggravates his discomfort.**The patient has been recommended to avoid any extreme exercises and frequent flexion or extension of the spine. No driving while on any meds that may alter mental status.**Follow-up with Primary Care Provider for general care and HTN.**Follow-up with Neurologist ( ) for treatment of seizure disorder**The patient will follow up with me in 4 weeks or earlier if necessary.**Information on nonopioid alternatives for the treatment of pain was given to the patient.**Increase Oxycodone 30 QID.**The medication(s) prescribed above are medically necessary and have been prescribed for the length of time indicated due to:**- Chronic Non-malignant Pain Syndrome described above in the assessment which requires ongoing pain management for more than 72hrs supply of controlled substances.**Do not drive while on any medications that may alter mental status.*************
